learning_objectives.objective: Recall the definitions of Mobile Content Management (MCM), Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM), Mobile Device Management (MDM), Mobile Application Management (MAM), and Bring Your Own Device (BYOD).
Explain the role of MCM as a subset of EMM and its focus on securing corporate data on mobile devices, distinguishing it from device-centric MDM.
Apply NIST SP 800-124 guidelines to outline step-by-step procedures for MCM implementation in a BYOD environment.
Analyze the relationships and differences between MCM, MDM, MAM, and EMM using a concept map or table, identifying common misconceptions (e.g., equating MCM with MDM).
Evaluate the security vs. usability trade-offs of MCM versus full MDM in BYOD scenarios, referencing NIST SP 800-124 and SP 1800-22C.
Design an MCM response plan for a lost BYOD device, integrating threat defense measures from NIST SP 1800-22C and broader cybersecurity principles like data loss prevention.
